newsitem.title: DUBAI: Bahrain detains Reuters newsman for over 24 hours.
newsitem.headline: Bahrain detains Reuters newsman for over 24 hours.

text.p: Bahrain detained a Reuters correspondent for more than 24 hours for questioning over a story he wrote on the political situation in the Gulf state.
Abbas Salman, 46, a Bahraini, was summoned to the Interior Ministry on Saturday morning and held overnight. He was released on Sunday afternoon.
Salman, who has worked for Reuters since 1977, said no charges were laid against him. Government officials in Bahrain were not available to comment on his detention.
Bahrain has been disturbed by political violence among dissidents in its majority Shi'ite Moslem community since December 1994 but now appears to have the unrest under control.
